body: r_c stares at the body of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} sibling, m_c, and can only think of the time they had together, and all the time they've now lost.
r_c feels numb to the news of m_c's death. How could {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} ever walk through a world without {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} sibling at {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} side?
A world without m_c at {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} side seems cold and empty to r_c, how can life continue on like nothing has happened?

r_c feels sick to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} stomach. The last time {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} saw m_c, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} quarreled with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, and now all r_c can do is beg for forgiveness and hope m_c is watching from StarClan.

r_c's voice wavers as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/talk/talks} about {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} sibling, trying to get through the tale and return to grieving over m_c's body. But {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/want/wants} m_c's vigil to be good, to show that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/were/was} loved.

With shaken, swollen eyes, r_c could do nothing but stare in silence. What happened? How and why m_c's cold body laid in front of {PRONOUN/r_c/object}? Even though r_c could see cats circling {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, shock, arguing, and sobbing, everything was muted; in term of colors and voices. And, it became worse when {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} legs nearly gave out and crumble from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} weighted heart, though thankfully someone caught {PRONOUN/r_c/object}. m_c was like another part of {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and now, without {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} sibling to enjoy another sunset together, r_c could only weep at the vigil.

It's hard for cats to bury a Clanmate. But it's even harder when that Clanmate was a sibling. r_c never knew {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} had to learn this so soon, realizing m_c belonged to StarClan now. Having to lick m_c for the last time, r_c choked back tears and screams as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} sunk {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} claws into the dirt, burying m_c.

A world without m_c at {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} side seems cold and empty to r_c, how can life continue on like nothing has happened?

r_c feels sick to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} stomach. The last time {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} saw m_c, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} quarreled with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, and now all r_c can do is beg for forgiveness and hope m_c is watching from StarClan.

r_c couldn't believe it. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} just couldn't. Not even if StarClan told {PRONOUN/r_c/object}. Of the size of the Clan, not a single eye could find m_c's missing body; stolen away to nature or, sadly, in the belly of a hungry beast. r_c had to be restrained to search the entire region-- possibly the entire world-- for {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} sibling. However, as days crept by, r_c's heart sunk when the truth revealed itself; m_c is gone.

It's normal to see m_c disappearing for a solo trip, but when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} were gone for moons, it became a new fear. r_c stood by watching and waiting for {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} sibling, hoping to see that rascal dragging in a heavy prey and that was why {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} took so long. Or, possibly playing another prank, though this time {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} would have a hefty paw to the muzzle. m_c wouldn't just... disappeared from this world. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} didn't wanted to hear it, but {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates had to tell {PRONOUN/r_c/object} otherwise to not starve {PRONOUN/r_c/self} waiting for someone that will never come back.
